title: Cooper Asks Jeffrey Lord: Is There Anything Trump ‘Could Do That You Would Ever Criticize?’
text:
Cooper Asks Jeffrey Lord: Is There Anything Trump ‘Could Do That You Would Ever Criticize?’ by Justin Baragona | 8:38 pm, February 16th, 2017 
During a panel discussion tonight on CNN, anchor Anderson Cooper directly confronted political commentator Jeffrey Lord over his tendency to find ways to defend President Donald Trump no matter what the topic or issue is. 
Discussing Trump’s exchange with NBC’s Peter Alexander at today’s press conference in which Alexander pressed the president for lying about the historic nature of his Electoral College victory, Cooper asked Lord if it concerns him when POTUS won’t take ownership of his falsehoods. 
Following Lord providing cover for Trump by stating that Trump said “I guess” during the back-and-forth, the former Reagan staffer added that this is all part of a reality show Trump is starring in and producing called ‘Beat the Press.’ 
“Turning the White House into a reality TV show,” Cooper responded. “Is that good for the country?” 
After Lord shot back with a question on whether television is good for the country, a weary Cooper wondered aloud if Lord would ever be critical of the president. 
“So is there anything Donald Trump could do that you would ever criticize?” Cooper asked. After asking him again, Lord replied by saying he just said that Trump made a mistake on his Electoral College win. 
“Is that good?” Lord asked, with a flustered Cooper moving on to another panelist.
